  • Methods
    • Uses the magic method __call and executes a closure/anonymous function that has been added to the classes $_methods using the addMethod() method.
      __callStatic
    • Adds a configuration to the Configuration class based upon a key and value.
      addConfiguration
    • Adds a closure/anonymous function to the object that can be called.
      addMethod
    • Adds a data to the public collection, index will be assigned automatically. Primarily used for adding launch quanties of data to the collection
      addToCollection
    • Adds data to the public collection. The data is assigned a key/index. If the key/index is already set, new information will override the old one.
      addToCollectionWithName
    • Retrieves a value that is in the public data collection or was pass through by the set method.
      get
    • Retrieves a stored configuration based upon the key that was assigned to it.
      getConfiguration
    • Returns the iterator for iterating through the values stored in the classes collection.
      getIterator
    • Initializes the configuration class by adding values to the collection available in the static parent object. Because the variable is added statically, the information will be available anywhere on the site.
      init
    • Outside of the standardrd xml file reading, a custom xml configuration can be set in the xml file and read when needed.
      loadXMLConfiguration
    • Adds a value to the classes Collection. By default the collection is stored in the public collection. The stored instance can be retrieved later by called in it's key value.
      set
  • » Protected
  • » Private
  • Constants

Configuration

The Configuration acts a global registry for system-wide configuration options for the application.

The configuration class is most notably used for setting variables that can be retrieved anywhere in your system with the setters and getters. There is also the option of setting different environment.

Example:

//Init the class
Configuration::init();

//Add An Example Configuration
$data = array(
    'host'=>'localhost',
    'database' => 'test',
    'user'=>'admin',
    'password'=>'abc123'
);
Configuration::addConfiguration('mysql',  $data);

//Retrieve and use that configuration
$mysql = Configuration::getConfiguration('mysql');
echo $mysql->host;

//Set different configs for different environments
Configuration::addConfiguration('mysql',  $data, array('environment' => 'production'));
package

system

access

public

Arguments

$method

string

The key/name assigned to the method when added

$args

mixed

Arguements to pass to the annoymous function. The function is called using call_user_func_array.

Response

mixed

$value The value returned is the value the stored function returns

Adds a configuration to the Configuration class based upon a key and value.

addConfiguration(string $key, string $value, array $options = array()) : void
